title: What Causes Yellow Tears? The Viral TikTok Video Explained

steps.title: Bright yellow tears are usually caused by fluorescein eye stain.
steps.content: Bright yellow tears are usually caused by fluorescein eye stain. In 2024, TikTok user ⭐️STARGIRL⭐️ posted a viral video of herself crying bright yellow tears after an eye exam. In response to questions about what caused this, popular TikTok physician Dr. Rubin posted a video explaining that the woman likely had a fluorescein eye stain. Fluorescein is a potent orange dye, so if someone cried directly afterward, their tears could appear bright yellow. [1] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source During this test, an eye doctor touches your eyes with a piece of blotting paper that has the dye on it, then they ask you to blink. This spreads the dye around the surface of your eyes. Next, the doctor shines a blue light onto your eyes. The combination of the dye and the blue light allows your doctor to see any foreign objects or damage to your cornea, which appear green. steps.title: Slightly yellow-looking tears might actually be abnormal eye discharge.
steps.content: Slightly yellow-looking tears might actually be abnormal eye discharge. If your tears look slightly yellow but you haven’t had a fluorescein test, it could be a sign of an infection or medical issue. For example, conjunctivitis (pink eye) , blepharitis (inflammation of the eyelids), and styes (infected oil glands on your eyelid) can cause yellow or green-colored discharge. In these cases, the discoloration is likely due to pus. [3] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you notice yellowish tears or discharge in your eyes, make an appointment with your doctor. They’ll be able to figure out the cause and treat any infection you might have. [4] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source
